poem:
"High Street Pilgrimage"

Monolith of Nationwide, to Virgin loped,
Cash-clad titan offering billions in worship.
Two lenders entwined, a sweet matrimony of money,
Pounding an alter with high street's melody.
A new giant birthed of sterling and statement,
In mortgage-syllogisms and savings' silent lament.
A glimpse of power, red and true,
In handshakes closed, economy's new stew.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nationwide to buy Virgin Money in £2.9bn deal Nationwide Building Society has agreed to buy Virgin Money in a deal that values its high street rival at nearly £3bn and would create the second-largest provider of mortgages and savings in the UK. The two lenders have reached a preliminary agreement on the key terms of a deal, which would create a new competitor with £366bn in total assets, according to a joint statement released on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
